subtitles_text: >> JEFF PROBST: Previously on
Survivor: For the past 18 days, the yellow
tribe, Kota, was the king of the jungle, winning eight out of ten
challenges. Kota, once again, immunity is
yours. The entire tribe was united,
except for Dan and Susie. >> I don't have the confidence
that we get to the merge and these people have got my back.
>> PROBST: Throughout the game, the red tribe, Fang,
consistently made questionable moves.
>> I'm stuck in a tribe that has no skills.
>> PROBST: Ace made a heads-up play...
>> That's the deal. >> Deal?
>> Deal. >> PROBST: ...when he pulled
Matty into an alliance with his long-time ally, Sugar.
>> I've been relying on Ace the whole time.
>> One of Sugar's biggest plusses is the fact that she has
the immunity idol. And I've got Sugar in my pocket.
>> PROBST: Their first move was to vote out Ace's biggest enemy,
Kelly. Kelly, the tribe has spoken.
12 are left. Who will be voted out tonight?
\xe2\x99\xaa \xe2\x99\xaa (animals chirping, chittering)
(animal squawks in distance) >> This is a tough game.
We're starving. >> There's nothing to eat.
I'm starting to lose my spirit, I'm starting to lose my hope.
It's-it's become hopeless. I'm hopeless about Fang.
>> What happened? >> As soon as I got up, it
tipped over. But just a little bit came out.
But I'll scoop it back in there, 'cause it... it was just a
little bit. >> That's a ton.
Rice is more valuable than gold, and she just clumsily trips over
it and spills it. I wanted to just lay into her
and chew her out, but I... it's just pointless.
You can't cry over spilled milk, you know?
It's just too late. Is it done?
>> Yeah. Not so bad. >> You guys ready?
>> Nothing like some fresh oatmeal rice.
>> I don't want to take away from you and Matty.
>> Crystal, eat. >> Ace, you eat.
>> Come on, please? >> You don't have to beg me.
You eat. I don't want to feel like I took
away from anybody in this tribe. So by all means, eat your full,
like you normally do. >> This tribe, Fang tribe, we're
not working together. Everybody has grudges against
each other. Matty and Ace are basically
going against Crystal. These guys are trying to call
the shots, and I don't like that, I don't like that at all.
>> You guys don't have to say anything, but your faces say a
thousand words. That's the difference between me
and you guys. >> Crystal did me a favor.
She will be the next lamb to the slaughter.
Captioning sponsored by   CBS PARAMOUNT
NETWORK TELEVISION (theme song playing)
\xe2\x99\xaa \xe2\x99\xaa (animal bellows)
>> My parents are, like, "Corinne, try not to curse so
much when you're there, because people are gonna think you're
trashy." (laughter)
>> I think Charlie and Marcus and Corinne seem very, very
tight, and at times almost exclusive.
And I'm just the type of person that I'm always gonna feel a
little bit vulnerable, a little bit insecure.
I mean, I wanted to clarify that I'm, like, a really sensitive
person. >> Yeah.
>> And it's weird when I'm not part of a group.
I kind of, like... it-it, like, makes me feel bad a little bit.
That's just me, like, that's how I am with groups.
>> Yeah. Yeah. >> You know, I like to be part
of the group. >> I would say that Dan is
socially inept in a lot of ways. I don't know if he's a former
fatty or why he wasn't liked as a child, but deep down inside
he's a little kid that's seeking approval.
>> It's different than Fang, where I alienated myself because
I didn't like those people. With you guys, it's completely
opposite. It's, like, all right, I really
like these three... >> Dan is the ultimate paranoid
human being. At some point, Dan is gonna be a
huge liability, and unfortunately, there's nothing I
can do to-to sort of save him from-from himself at this point.
>> Do you feel better? >> Yeah, I do.
>> Okay. >> Do you guys?
>> Yeah. >> All right. Good.
\xe2\x99\xaa \xe2\x99\xaa >> PROBST: Come on in, guys!
Kota getting your first look at the new Fang Tribe.
Kelly voted out at the last Tribal Council.
All right, you guys ready to get to today's challenge?
>> OTHERS: Oh, yeah. Yeah. >> PROBST: For today's
challenge, gonna play a little game of keep-away.
On my "go," three members of each tribe will toss a breakable
ball back and forth, while one member of the other tribe
attempts to smash that ball or force it to the ground.
You'll be playing at the same time, in two rings.
The tribe whose attacker breaks their opponent's ball first wins
a point. We are playing to three.
Want to know what you're playing for?
>> Yeah. >> Hell, yeah.
>> PROBST: The winning tribe will be picked up by helicopter,
flown to a beautiful location here in Gabon.
You'll be bringing with you everything you need for a nice
afternoon picnic. (gasps)
>> Beer. >> Beers.
>> PROBST: You have some bread, veggies, meats, cheeses...
>> Cheese! >> PROBST: ...some nice drinks.
It should be a fun afternoon. In addition, the winning tribe
will send one member of the losing tribe to Exile Island.
Worth playing for? >> OTHERS: Oh, yeah. Yeah.
>> PROBST: Kota, you have two extra members.
Who's gonna sit this one out? Charlie and I would like to be
the cheerleaders today. >> PROBST: Corinne, Charlie,
take a spot on the bench. Everybody else, I'll give you a
minute to strategize, we'll get started.
First round, Randy, the attacker for Kota, will be going up
against Fang. Ace, the attacker for Fang,
he'll be going up against Kota. Fang looking to break a
five-challenge losing streak. Survivors, ready...
Go! Ace goes after Bob in the Kota
ring. Randy very aggressive in the
Fang ring. >> Yes!
>> PROBST: Ball hits the ground. Kota scores first point!
(cheering) >> Yeah, Kota!
>> Over. >> PROBST: Kota leads: one-zip.
Next round, Bob, the attacker for Kota, Sugar, the attacker
for Fang. >> (growls)
>> This guy is so ugly over here.
He's such an ugly person. He's mean.
>> PROBST: This should be fun. >> Yeah.
>> PROBST: Survivors, ready... Go!
Sugar being aggressive, giving everything she has trying to
score for Fang. Bob takes Kenny out, doesn't
help. Fang's still alive.
Bob takes a hard fall. Stay after him, Sugar.
Be a hero. >> (laughs): Okay.
>> PROBST: Fang needs to score. Sugar, you need to pick it up.
Do not drop that ball. >> (grunts)
>> PROBST: Big takedown from Bob!
It doesn't work, though-- Ace keeps the ball alive.
>> Nice, Ace! >> PROBST: Sugar doing
nothing, absolutely nothing. >> Come on, Sugar!
>> PROBST: Sugar's gonna have to get aggressive, try to make
something happen. Bob almost deflects it!
No! Another takedown by Bob on Matty!
>> (laughing) >> Come on, Sugar!
>> PROBST: Ace tries to get it past Bob, but Bob shuts him
down! Kota scores again!
Kota leads: two-zip. We are playing to three.
This could be it. Next round, attacking for Kota
is Dan. He could end this challenge.
Attacking for Fang is Matty, trying to keep Fang alive for a
big reward. Survivors, ready...
Go! Matty comes out strong, chasing
after that ball quickly. Dan very aggressive on Ace.
Ace gets rid of it to Crystal. Crystal to Sugar, back to Ace.
Ace back to Sugar. No! Dan causes the ball to break!
Kota scores! Kota wins reward!
(excited chatter) All right, Kota, big decision.
You're sending one member of Fang to Exile Island.
>> Let's go ahead and send Sugar.
>> PROBST: Sugar, this is unprecedented.
I don't think we've ever had anybody be sent to Exile five
times, back-to-back-to-back... to-back-to-back.
>> Yeah, I'm here to break records, you know. (laughs)
>> PROBST: All right, Sugar, get your stuff.
>> Sugar is a pinup model. She is completely worthless when
it comes to challenges. So when it comes to Sugar in
this game... I would really, really, really desire her to go.
>> PROBST: Kota, it should be a fun afternoon.
(indistinct chatter) Fang, I got nothing for you.
>> We lost the biggest reward yet.
It's hard, you know, when you see them walking away.
They have everything, and we have nothing.
And we see Kota in their beautiful chopper just lavishing
in their reward, you know? It's madness, it's total
madness. \xe2\x99\xaa \xe2\x99\xaa
>> Reward was a helicopter ride, and I was lucky enough to have
the front-row seat. Just seeing that incredible
crater, it made my trip to Africa.
The only thing that was beating faster than the rotors on that
helicopter was the beating of my heart.
>> Oh, wow. >> Close as I want to get.
>> Holy cow. >> Stay away from the edge.
>> You're making me nervous, Marcus.
The beautiful scenery, it was awesome.
It's something I thought I would never experience, so it just
gives you more incentive, more power, more strength to know
that you can get through this, no matter what.
So it was very... it was very surreal for me.
It was just amazing. >> Let's get our blanket out.
>> This is great, let's get our blanket out.
>> Sardines! Ha-ha! >> I don't think in
my entire 29 years of living I've ever been so embarrassed.
I'm humiliated. I felt pathetic. My spirits are dropping so fast.
I look over, and, like, Sugar, she's just, she can't do
anything. She's just being dominated.
It was pointless for us to even keep going.
She was just standing there getting walked all over.
I hate it. I'm starting to get pissed.
As long as there's physical challenges, we're gonna lose.
Want to take a boat ride, Ace? >> Sure, bro.
>> We need to take out Sugar. Okay, this is what we do.
We go Kenny, Crystal and I vote for Sugar.
You don't have to vote for Sugar, so you're not
backstabbing her, okay? Sugar's gone, and it's you and I
to the merge a hundred percent. There's no question.
>> You know we're a hundred percent, you and me.
>> No, I don't know that. We're aligned.
Me and you are aligned, so make me comfortable.
We need to take out Sugar or at least get the idol out.
>> Yeah, I see the logic, dude. I see that logic.
>> Okay, we know exactly where it's sitting, and we can use it
to our advantage when we have to.
>> You know what they're talking about, right, Cri?
>> Yeah, those two asses out there in the boat trying to get
me off. >> They are. Will you trust me?
>> I've been there with you from day one, Kenny.
>> We have to blindside Ace. >> Yeah.
>> I have to talk to Sugar. Crystal, you trust me a
hundred percent, right? >> I trust you a hundred
percent. >> Okay.
>> I can feel Ace, right now, strategically, wants to get rid
of me. The way that he's manipulating
Matty, he's a devil. And he has to go.
>> This is... this is awesome. >> Getting this is just
incomparable. >> And the best part about this
is they don't get it. >> And they may be completely
out of rice, to add insult to injury.
>> Oh, oh... >> What is this?
>> Oh, my... >> Oh, my God!
>> Wait, stop. Everyone, shh! >> Holy cow, these are letters
from home. >> Oh, my God, they're letters!
Oh, my God! Oh, my God! (gasps)
Oh, my God! They're really letters!
>> (sobbing) >> Bob, are you okay, man?
>> No, I'm not! >> Your family loves you, Bob.
>> I know it. (sobbing) (grunts)
I don't know which one to read first.
This is from David. >> My dad, he never writes
anything, and he wrote me a letter.
>> Isn't that cool? >> He never writes anything.
He wasn't even excited. He didn't show any excitement
when I was leaving. Wow.
>> "You should receive..." I can't read it.
My eyes keep blurring. I'm close to these people here,
but these are the people that are the closest to my heart.
Life is good. And I realize how lucky a man I
am. I'm here.
And I can't... I can't wait to get home to
them. Life doesn't get better than
this. >> Back to the Sugar Shack
for me. I don't really know what the
hell's happening in this game. I'm just...
trying to survive. (laughs) Thank God for Ace.
What's funny is I'm pretty sure we're using each other, but I
feel like my tribe thinks I'm naive and that I'm sticking
with him out of stupidity, but I'm sticking with him because
he's the strongest player at this point.
So I just hope that they're not all screwing me around.
>> PROBST: Come on in, guys! We'll now bring in Sugar,
returning from Exile Island. >> PROBST: All right, you guys
ready to get to today's immunity challenge?
>> Yeah. >> PROBST: First things first,
Dan, I will take it back. Thank you.
Good news and bad news about today's challenge.
Bad news is, both tribes are going to Tribal Council tonight.
Both tribes are gonna vote somebody out.
The good news, each of you will have an equal shot at winning...
individual immunity. It's a log roll.
You're gonna match up against another tribe member.
It might be somebody from the other tribe.
It might be somebody from your own tribe.
Your goal is to stay on the log longer than the other person.
First person to hit the water is out.
Winners move on. Last person left standing wins
immunity and is safe at tonight's Tribal Council.
>> I think I may have a target on my back, so it's very, very
important for me personally to go in there and win, and not
just win by a little. Win by a lot.
>> PROBST: In addition, there is a twist which will be revealed
after the challenge is over. >> Another twist?
>> PROBST: We'll draw numbers, get our matchups, we'll get
started. All right, first matchup, Dan
taking on Ace. All right, here we go.
Put a foot on the log. Three, two, one, walk.
We are on. First matchup. Good footwork.
Dan is in the water. Ace moves on to the next round!
Next round, Charlie versus Crystal.
This challenge is on. Charlie and Crystal looking to
move on. Crystal in the water first.
Charlie moving on to the next round.
Big matchup, Marcus versus Matty.
Good save by Marcus. Matty's in the water.
Marcus moving on to the next round!
Randy taking on Susie. Both from the Kota tribe.
Nice footwork. Ah! Susie in the water first.
Randy moving on to the next round.
Kenny versus Sugar. Two Fang members.
>> This dumb thing. (laughs) >> I can't even move this.
>> PROBST: Can he fight to hang on?
No! Kenny in the water first. Sugar moving on.
Last of the first rounds, Bob and Corinne.
>> Of course he did. (laughter)
>> PROBST: Who knew that would come in handy?
Here we go, Bob versus Corinne. Bob, the former log roll winner.
Three, two, one, walk. (Bob whistling, Sugar laughing)
Corinne in the water first. Bob moving on!
All right, semifinal round. We have our matchups.
Charlie taking on Ace. Go.
>> Come on, Charlie. >> PROBST: The winner moves on
to the final round. Ace staying alive.
Charlie's got him on the run. Great match. Ace on the run.
Can he recover? Charlie's in the water first!
Ace moving on to the final! Very close.
Now it is Marcus taking on Randy.
One of you will move on to the final round.
>> Come on, Randy. >> PROBST: Randy on the run.
Randy in the water first. Marcus moving on to the final
round. All right, next round, Sugar
versus Bob. We're on.
Winner moves on to the final round to join Ace and Marcus.
Great match. Sugar not going anywhere.
Bob slips, trying to hang on. Bob is back up, a great

Bob in the water first. Sugar moving on.
>> Congratulations! >> PROBST: The log rolling

(laughter) For the final round, all three
of you will be on the log at the same time.
(groaning) Take your spots.
For the final round, Ace, we drew for spots, you got the
middle. You guys put a foot on the log,
hold it steady. >> You know, I feel this win is
enormous, so it's important that I win this challenge.
If I can pull it off, I'll be proud of myself.
If not, I'll probably shoot myself in the pinky toe.
>> PROBST: The challenge is on. Three people on the log at once.
The last person on the log wins immunity.
Good footwork by all three. Sugar with a nice save.
Another nice save by Marcus. Sugar on the run.
Another nice save. Everybody still alive.
Sugar in the water first! It's Ace and Marcus fighting

Ace in the water first! Marcus wins individual immunity.
>> Whoo! >> PROBST: Congratulations.
(applause) Marcus, safe at tonight's Tribal
Council. Now, to the twist, this is yours
to read. Read it out loud so everybody
can hear it. >> "You will now assign immunity
to one member of the other tribe."
I'm going to give this to Sugar.
>> PROBST: Sugar, come on over. (applause)
>> My hope is that Sugar is smart enough to keep the
immunity idol to herself and that might actually end up
giving us one of our biggest surprises, which would be
losing a big power player from the Fang tribe in Ace, Matty,
or Crystal. >> PROBST: Sugar safe at
tonight's Tribal Council for Fang.
Marcus is safe for Kota's. >> When I saw Sugar with the
immunity necklace around her neck, I'm like, "Damn!
This girl has two idols!" She is now the most powerful

from the other tribe to give immunity to?
>> I don't know. >> You don't know?
>> Maybe Susie. >> Susie?
>> Yeah. >> Yeah, you think Susie's gonna
be gone tonight? >> I think that's irritating
people. >> Oh.
Matty and Ace, they're thinking to get rid of Crystal
and it all depends on the pin-up girl, Sugar.
So, yeah, I will lie in this game.
I will do everything in my power to get her to vote with
me because my life and Crystal's life rests upon her.
So, basically, this is honest to God truth.
This is what's happening around camp.
I'm not lying to you. Matty goes, "We're voting out
Sugar next immunity challenge." And then Crystal's like, "Okay."
So then when Crystal went away, I looked at Ace, I'm like,
"Are we really voting out Sugar?"
And Ace is like, "Right now  Sugar is really good for nothing
except for the hidden immunity idol."
They think you're like clueless, you're like a dumb
blonde or whatever. Okay, and Ace thinks he has
you wrapped around his finger. >> Okay.
I don't trust Kenny, he might have been lying to me.
But I have been trusting the biggest snake in the game so
far and I've known that. So, I really don't know who to
trust at any point in this game. >> Ace is like, "Well, I
actually got the hidden immunity idol from her once, I can

the hidden immunity idol." And I was like, "Oh, my freaking
God, this guy is a snake." >> You and I will say we're
voting on Crystal. >> We blindside Ace.
>> Blindside Ace today. >> And we don't have to worry
about the snake ever again. >> Never again.
>> I trust Sugar and I trust that she will go along with the
plan to vote out Ace. She may be the pin-up girl, but
she's very smart. >> Kenny has reassured me all is
well. I will truly believe Sugar when
she writes Ace's name down. Either she's going to write my

>> Why? Who's going to do that?
They'd only have two votes. Matty's with you.
>> They'd have three votes. >> No, it'd be Kenny and
Crystal, wouldn't it? >> I gave it back to you last
time. I'll give it back to you this
time. >> Oh, Ace, I gotta think
about it, okay? >> That's fine.
>> You make me feel awful. When Ace asked me for the idol,
it made me think maybe Kenny was telling me the truth.
>> Don't you think after... >> Ace definitely knows how to
finagle people much more than I've ever seen anybody do,
probably in my life. But he's definitely had my back.
>> I'll bring the last of it, and then that's it.
>> All right, go for it. >> Crystal's supposed to go
next, but plans could change. Ace could be turning on me now.
I have no idea. Oh, God, what am I gonna do with
this thing? >> PROBST: Sugar, you've been
out here 21 days. Tell me about camp life.
What's going on? >> Um, we are very low on rice.
Crystal accidentally knocked some over, and she didn't eat
because she knocked it over. >> PROBST: Kenny, how much rice
did you have before Crystal knocked it over?
>> We had about seven days worth.
Crystal ended up scooping some of the rice that she spilled
outside back into the pot. So, probably had about five and
a half days worth of rice. >> PROBST: So, Matty, the rice
is so valuable, that if you spill even a little in the dirt,
you gotta pick it out grain by grain.
>> The rice is valuable. It's the most valuable thing we
have. We get about six to eight
spoonfuls a day of rice. >> PROBST: Wow.
>> And she spills the rice, and nobody goes, "God, Crystal,
what are you doing?!" Nobody... >> No, but your faces said it
all. >> Just simmer down.
>> Your face said it all. >> My face says it all... nobody
says a word to her. >> Because they knew it was an
accident. >> Exactly, so just...
>> I didn't purposely go over to the rice box and just throw the
rice down. >> Just let me get to my point.
Can I get to my point? >> Get to your point and then
I'll talk. >> So, then we looked past it.
We moved past that issue. >> PROBST: Ace, make sense of
that for me. >> Crystal made a mistake.
That's common. The whole part of us feeling
angry at her I thought was a bit concocted in her own head.
>> Now I'm delusional. I can see it on your face, Ace.
Okay, don't look at me like that.
When Matty turned around he was like, "Oh, whatever."
Then he made some look at you, Ace.
I didn't say anything to anybody.
I just sat down there picking up about 20,000 grains of rice
and then they started to eat. "Oh, Crystal, come on and eat."
No, I spilled some of the rice so I will go without and
that's what I did and that's why I did it.
>> Nobody asked you to, Crystal. >> It's not like you saved me
any anyways-- you still ate it. >> I asked you three times...
>> Yeah, I mean, if you cared enough you would've saved me
some anyways. >> PROBST: Sugar, you have,
like, the perfect seat in the midst of this great
Shakespearean drama. >> I know.
>> PROBST: Your eyes are like saucers.
>> This sounds like such petty bull crap to me.
I mean, I think that we can get past our issues better than
this, and this is why we haven't been winning, because people are
holding these stupid, petty things against each other.
>> PROBST: All right, Sugar, you have individual immunity
tonight. You can assign that to somebody
else or keep it for yourself. >> Keeping it.
>> PROBST: Sugar is safe tonight.
Everybody else is fair game. It is time to vote.
Ace, you're up. >> You're one of the snakes, and
I got to get rid of you. Go home.
>> Crystal, I've been waiting for this day for so long, and I
am so happy it's here. >> PROBST: I'll go tally the

the decision is final. The person voted out will be

I'll read the votes. First vote, Ace.
Crystal. One vote Ace, one vote Crystal.
Ace. Two votes Ace, one vote Crystal.
We're tied. Two votes Crystal, two votes
Ace, one vote left. Seventh person voted out of
Survivor: Gabon... Ace. That's three.
You need to bring me your torch. >> PROBST: Ace, the tribe has
spoken. >> Good luck, guys.
>> PROBST: Well, based on the reaction from Ace, I'd say that
was a blindside. 21 days in, Fang is finally
starting to play this game. Grab your torches.
Head back to camp. Good night.
Don't go away. Coming up next, Kota prepares
for their own Tribal Council. >> Right now would be an
optimal time to get me out. >> PROBST: While Dan digs his
own grave... Susie commits social suicide.
>> I was actually going to vote you.
>> Really?! I hate her.
I want her gone, yesterday. >> Can I ask you a question?
>> What? >> I'm not going tonight, am I?
>> Not that I know of. Given the fact that everyone's
voting for Susie. >> It has to be Susie, 'cause
we have no idea. We could stay together as a

>> Please trust us. >> Yeah.
>> And, you know... >> And-and that is incredible

>> Randy's replaced Bob in a final four situation, because I
think Randy's willing to cast his lot in with a good group of

the totem pole. She's bound to.
She may continue to dig her grave all day long, and-and

>> As annoying as Bob is, I see him as being as loyal and

>> But I'm closer being able to say it about Susie than I am

tonight. And the only thing Dan has going
for him right now is that he should really cross his fingers
that Susie's going to blow up and do some crazy stuff.
>> I really like you, and I don't want you to go home.
So I'm not writing your name down, and I just wanted you to
know that. You're just not on my list of...
>> Do you know who-who they're thinking about voting out?
>> Um, I think that it's going to be Dan.
>> That's what your-- your guess is it's gonna be Dan?
>> I think so, yeah. But we felt like we don't want
to take somebody that's gonna flip.
I feel really good about the fact that you wouldn't.
>> No, I wouldn't, as long as you keep me in the loop.
I-I figured people were talking, and I figured eventually they
would come to me and tell me where I'm at, you know.
'Cause I-- when I was gonna-- Okay, I'm gonna be honest with
you. I was actually going to vote
you, because... >> Why?
>> Because I know that I'm a hard worker.
I-I know that without having fire and water and food, how are
you going to perform physically? You're going to have to take
that time to do that work. >> Mm-hmm.
>> So I'm just being totally up front with you, so, and
that's the truth. >> Okay, so you need me to help
more. >> Well, yeah, I need help from
everybody, actually. So that's where I'm at.
But I-I appreciate that, 'cause now I know which way I can

that she'd like me to go. Really?!
I hate her. I hate her, hate her, hate her.
Like, I really want to stab her in the face.
And if you piss me off, you've pissed off my alliance.
>> Did I not say to you guys she's nuts?
I mean, certifiable. >> But she's the worst kind of
nuts, 'cause you don't see it coming.
>> She goes whichever way the wind is blowing.
>> Um, I mean, I hate her. I want her gone, yesterday.
>> Susie's game is no game. And the problem with no game is
her vote can be bought. She's gone.
>> Tonight, I don't want any sort of curveball.
I do not want to go home tonight.
I don't know what could be cooking.
I mean, Dan doesn't have the idol, does he?
>> Not that I know of. >> What if Susie and Dan get
together, Dan has the idol, and he's like, "Let's both
